meanings.definition: The quality or state of being white.
meanings.sent1: The whiteness of the snow made everything look magical.
meanings.sent2: She admired the whiteness of the clouds against the blue sky.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a touch of whiteness to the dish by sprinkling some grated cheese on top.
meanings.sent4: The whiteness of her dress symbolized purity and innocence.
meanings.sent5: The whiteness of the paper made her hesitate to start drawing, afraid to ruin its pristine look.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is white in color.
meanings.sent1: The whiteness of the walls in the room made it feel more spacious.
meanings.sent2: The whiteness of the wedding dress stood out among the colorful decorations.
meanings.sent3: The artist exaggerated the whiteness of the canvas by using pure white paint.
meanings.sent4: The whiteness of the milk in the glass contrasted with the dark table.
meanings.sent5: The whiteness of the swan's feathers shimmered in the sunlight, captivating all who saw.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being white in complexion.
meanings.sent1: Her skin's whiteness was a result of staying indoors most of the time.
meanings.sent2: The whiteness of his face showed his shock at the unexpected news.
meanings.sent3: The clown's exaggerated whiteness of face made the children burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The whiteness of the polar bear's fur helped it blend into the snowy landscape.
meanings.sent5: The whiteness of the ghost's appearance sent shivers down everyone's spine.
